intro: Menispermum abuta, commonly known as Indian snakeroot, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Southeast Asia. It is a deciduous shrub that typically grows to a height of 1–3 meters, featuring heart-shaped leaves and clusters of small, greenish-white flowers. The plant produces yellowish-orange berries that contain the seeds, which are dispersed by birds. It belongs to the family Menispermaceae and is valued for its medicinal properties in traditional medicine. Its roots and leaves have been used to treat various ailments, including inflammation and digestive issues.
